events.message: The claimant reported a car collision that occurred on April 30th involving two vehicles at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under 'Auto Accident' due to keywords such as car and collision found in the initial report.
An agent specialized in auto accident claims was assigned to manage the case and assist the claimant with the process.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment to the claimant confirming receipt of the claim submission.
Additional documents were requested from the claimant, including the police report and photographs of the damaged vehicle.
The claimant submitted all requested documents, including the police report, photos, and a repair estimate.
An investigation was initiated to verify the circumstances of the vehicle collision and assess damage liability.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and damage estimates align with submitted documents.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the full cost of repairs and rental car expenses during the repair period.
The claimant responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and quick resolution.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance committee following the claimant’s acceptance of the settlement.
The payment covering repair costs was issued and transferred to the claimant’s account as agreed.
The claim was formally closed following successful payment and confirmation that repairs were completed.
All case files and documentation were archived for future reference as the auto accident claim process concluded.
